content: this quick and easy hat was inspired by the knitters of instagram #knitting who are always sharing pictures of their lovely cabled hats it features seven big fat 12-stitch cables against a backdrop of reverse stockinette wear it pointy or wear it round up to you it s your head via silversheep s project notes **for a less pointy crown ** decrease every round instead of every other round **for a turned-up brim ** knit the brim to at least 3 inches so you can turn it up **important ** * the ribbing is knit on smaller needles to ensure a good fit use bigger needles and the hat will be too large * the body/cabling is done on large needles to ensure that the cables don t make the hat too tight and un-stretchy * i highly recommend using **wool** with this pattern --followed by a light blocking after soaking and drying the cables bloom and look much more even * feeling adventurous try replacing the reverse stockinette stitch with garter stitch ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ should fit most adult heads and probably most teens 28 stitches = 4 inches in ribbing on smaller needles 24 stitches = 4 inches in cable pattern on larger needles one ball of cascade 220 and you re set
